column4: Tobbertot: You mean start a live session and format the prtitions ?

if you can be more specific with your question you'll probably get a better response

did you run gparted with sudo?
also, you can't change paritions while they are mounted
the picture you posted was too small for me to read
hold on
yes?
same problem, open up a terminal and run 'sudo fdisk -l /dev/hda' and pastebin that
after you ran the command?
did it output anything?
you put in a quotation mark, take tha tout
Ctrl+C and then take out the quote
I put the /dev/hda(iuts a empty disc to backup files)  and /dev/sda ( its the SATA drive that i use)
http://paste.ubuntubrasil.org/309
hda parameter just show my empty disc.. .
In true my SATA driver is the sda1 ..the partitions that i dont see in linux is sda5..sda6

pastebin the output
